@sdcit wrote:

chr(13) is enter. It’s not a string, so the + adds it

item.title: [RS2]Autologin - First Script
item.dc:creator: @Blizzind Blizzind
item.description:
@Blizzind wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:3, topic:880”]Standards and procedues help you.

[code]const
UserName = ‘’;
PassWord = ‘’;

Procedure SendUserAndPass;
begin
SendKeysSilent(UserName + chr(13));
SendKeysSilent(PassWord);
end;[/code][/quote]

Im trying to get into scar scripting and im having a hard time :P. So can someone please explain to me why you put the + chr(13)); thing on the end of this command?

SendKeysSilent(UserName + chr(13));

Read full topic

item.title: [RS2]Autologin - First Script
item.dc:creator: @Nashiu Nashiu
item.description:
@Nashiu wrote:

Not too bad except you’re having it click on the pixels only for your computer. It might be different pixels on other computers so you might have it do something with a findcolor or bitmap instead. Other than that it’s better than my first script. Rofl don’t even ask what it was.

Read full topic

item.title: [RS2]Autologin - First Script
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

It’s not really a var, it’s a const. It can’t be changed when the script is running(correct me if I’m wrong) but (‘this is a string’) (this_is_a_var_or_const).

Say if you have I as an integer. i:=random(5000), sendkeys(inttostr(i)).

IntToStr means Integer To String and then (i), the integer var to be converted. I’d imagin you can use StrToInt, the oppasite.

Read full topic

item.title: [RS2]Autologin - First Script

item.description:

You might want to put a wait in between the sendkeyssilent for username and password, because no one can hit enter that fast.
